taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek chrysos, gold, and lepis, scale, referring to yellow glands on various organs of the plant]

bio:treatment.discussion: Nuts are sweet and edible but difficult to remove from the spiny cupules unless completely ripe. The two species of Chrysolepis have sometimes been included in Castanopsis; the latter, however, is a related genus of Fagaceae, native to Asia, with very different cupule structure (H.Hjelmquist 1948; L.L. Forman 1966).
